parents.mother: Sebille daughter of Demenge de la Levee

confession.seduction_context: First appeared in barn asking if she would be his 'amoureuse', promising to be a good match. Seduced a week later outside house at dusk.

timeline.subject: Fleuratte veuve Anthoine Valdexey
timeline.details: Confrontations with witnesses, accused them of various crimes

timeline.subject: Fleuratte veuve Anthoine Valdexey
timeline.details: Procureur for chapter asks for question extraordinaire

timeline.subject: Fleuratte veuve Anthoine Valdexey
timeline.details: Given thumbscrews and rack, continued to deny, asked to be released until morning

timeline.subject: Fleuratte veuve Anthoine Valdexey
timeline.details: Placed on rack again, threatened with renewed torture, started to confess

timeline.subject: Fleuratte veuve Anthoine Valdexey
timeline.details: Confirmed confessions same afternoon, added accomplice names

timeline.subject: Fleuratte veuve Anthoine Valdexey
timeline.details: Change de Nancy asks for repetition of confessions

timeline.subject: Fleuratte veuve Anthoine Valdexey
timeline.details: Final repetition of confessions and approval for execution from Change de Nancy

prior_accusations.context: Undated copy of accusation, almost certainly executed 1621. Also named multiple other people.

notable_quotes.speaker: Fleuratte veuve Anthoine Valdexey
notable_quotes.french: qu'ilz ne plaideroient davantage mais qu'ilz en auroient bien la raison d'autre faceon
notable_quotes.english: that they would not plead/argue any more, but that they would have reason to regret it in another way
notable_quotes.context: Threat to Germaine after being prevented from building wall

notable_quotes.speaker: Fleuratte veuve Anthoine Valdexey
notable_quotes.english: Shoo, shoo (to a cat or master)
notable_quotes.context: Said in field when wind arose, which ceased when she spoke

notable_quotes.speaker: Fleuratte veuve Anthoine Valdexey
notable_quotes.french: pour ladite jument l'on avoit esté au devin ainsy qu'on disoit
notable_quotes.english: for the said mare they had been to the diviner as they said
notable_quotes.context: Explaining the burning of the mare's heart

notable_quotes.speaker: Fleuratte veuve Anthoine Valdexey
notable_quotes.french: qu'elle at esté au devin nommement Michiel Colin Michiel et qu'a ce moyen l'on dit qu'elle est sorciere et qu'elle a faict tomber ledit Michiel de ses corbes ou il eut un bras rompu, et qu'un nommé Jean Bruyeres demeurant on Vic luy mescroyeroit la perte de beaucoup de son bestail qu'il perdoit
notable_quotes.english: that she had been to the diviner namely Michiel Colin Michiel and that for this reason they say she is a witch and that she made the said Michiel fall from his baskets where he broke an arm, and that one named Jean Bruyeres living in Vic would blame her for the loss of much of his livestock that he lost
notable_quotes.context: Counteraccusation against witness Zabel during confrontation

Germaine veuve Mengel Colas Demenge Durand

economic_context.details: Husband's property had been confiscated after his execution. Witness Marie femme Claude Hidoulf bought field from seigneurs that had been confiscated from accused's husband. Dispute with Germaine about wall construction. Witness referred to economic losses of 6-700 francs from animal deaths. Accused worked as weaver, suggesting modest economic status.

harms_catalog.victim_name: cow of Colas de la Maize
harms_catalog.harm_description: became as if rabid, had to be buried alive
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: he had denounced her husband at trial June 1615

harms_catalog.victim_name: second cow of Colas de la Maize
harms_catalog.harm_description: sickened, recovered after eating bread, salt, and leeks from accused's house
harms_catalog.method_alleged: cured by eating bread, salt, and leeks from her house (counter-magic)

harms_catalog.harm_description: wind seemed to get up with great noise and frightened witness, ceased when accused said 'Chay, Chay'
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: reaping in confiscated field, asked if she had taken too much

harms_catalog.victim_name: animals of Germaine veuve Mengel Colas Demenge Durand
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: dispute about wall they wanted to build
harms_catalog.time_between_quarrel_and_harm: after they had been prevented from building
harms_catalog.method_alleged: witchcraft, confirmed by burning mare's heart test - accused appeared at door same day

harms_catalog.harm_description: killed by fall from cherry tree
harms_catalog.method_alleged: she went to give news before anyone else knew

harms_catalog.harm_description: no fruit that year, as predicted by accused
harms_catalog.time_between_quarrel_and_harm: same year as Colas Valdexey's death
harms_catalog.method_alleged: prediction by her daughter that there would be no fruit, which came true

harms_catalog.harm_description: illness cured by obtaining bread and salt from accused's house
harms_catalog.method_alleged: cured by counter-magic (bread and salt from her house)
openly accused by Claude Vincent without her reaction

harms_catalog.harm_description: lost a cow, buried it so other animals would not be infected, stones piled on grave found in disarray next day

harms_catalog.victim_name: goat of Mathiatte femme Mengeon Christophe
harms_catalog.harm_description: fell ill and finally had to be killed
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: discussed goat when passing by her house

harms_catalog.harm_description: made ill, then healed by accused
harms_catalog.method_alleged: confession states she made ill then healed (demonstrates power)

harms_catalog.harm_description: killed to test powder given by devil

material_culture.context: Used as counter-magic cure for bewitched cow, obtained from accused's house
Burned to identify witch who caused animal deaths
Given by devil Persin at seduction
Devil gave what he said was money but turned out to be pieces of glass
Given by devil - black to kill animals, red to kill people, green to cure
Gave master a cock each year to be let off more frequent sabbat attendance
Fleuratte bought field to reap 30 years before
Dispute with Germaine about wall they wanted to build
Payment for reaping work (2 francs and a loaf each)

spatial_references.context: Main location of trial, where accused lived
Specific residence location of accused, also location of accuser and some witnesses
Location of witness Zabel femme Bresson Jeandel
Origin of accused's maternal grandfather, location of accomplice Didier de la Levee
Location of Marguitte wife of Jean Carset named in initial accusation
Location of Blaise Colas Bertrand who had called husband a witch
Location of Jean Bruyeres mentioned in counteraccusation
Where accused and witness Zabel slept 30 years before when reaping oats
Where wind incident occurred with Marie femme Claude Hidoulf
Where Colas Valdexey fell to his death

economic_hardship_indicators: significant economic losses from animal deaths (6-700 francs)

prior_legal_disputes.description: Quarrel with Nicolas Valdexey over 'retraicte' he wanted to use on land she and husband had bought, 12 years before his fatal fall

legal_context.redress_outcome: Accused noted that husband did not seek reparation when called witch by Blaise Colas Bertrand, which she used as evidence he had been witch for long time

hearsay_chains.content: heard from Vincent Claude Vincent that he had obtained bread and salt from her house to cure his wife
if he knew it would only cost him 100 francs he would have her eldest unmarried daughter arrested
Claude Vincent had told him how he had openly accused her of being a witch and killing his horse
claimed to have heard her and husband talking over dinner shortly before his arrest

hearsay_chains.source: wife of Jean Bruyeres and Mengel des Roses

emotional_state_notes: asked to be released after first torture session
continued denials until threatened with renewed torture
started to confess when placed on rack again

reproaches_to_witnesses.objection: Nicolas de la Maize was son of a thief, and his mother had been accused by Colatte
Father of Marie femme Claude Hidoulf had said she made him die more than a week before his time (Marie denied this)
Germaine veuve Mengel Colas Demenge Durand was reputed a whore, having twice given promises of marriage she had not kept
Zabel had been to diviner Michiel Colin Michiel, was reputed witch, made him fall and break arm, blamed for livestock losses by Jean Bruyeres

extraction_metadata.notes: Complete trial record with detailed witness testimony, torture, confession, and execution. Husband Anthoine Valdexey was executed in June 1615 (trial w309 references this). Accused was widow of executed witch and widely reputed to be more dangerous than her husband. Notable features: (1) Counter-magic healing with bread/salt/leeks from accused's house used by multiple people; (2) Burning mare's heart divination test that allegedly brought accused to door; (3) Detailed barn incident 30 years prior with possible devil visitation; (4) Strong counterattack strategy during confrontations accusing witnesses of various crimes; (5) Confession only obtained under threat of renewed torture after initial torture session failed. Multiple accomplices named including living people (Claude Vincent, Jehennon Bon Claude, Didier de la Levee, Georgeon Jean Durand) and dead ones (husband, accuser Colatte, Claude des Feignes and sister Agathe, Franceatte femme Claudel Jardel). Economic status assessed as 'poor' based on: weaver occupation, property confiscation from husband's execution, widow status, but had resources to buy oat field 30 years earlier. Healing practice evident from curing with green powder in confession and multiple witnesses using counter-magic from her house. Language region: French (all quotes in French, location in French-speaking Lorraine). Notable that accused had knowledge suggesting she practiced some form of healing/cunning work given the counter-magic cures.
